item.title: Office hours
item.description:
Here are my office hours for the Winter semester 2023/24:

  • Monday 14:15-15:15 (H-4, 204)
  • Thursday 14:15-15:15 (H-4, 204)
  • Friday 9:15-11:15 (MS Teams)


During the hours marked "MS Teams," I will be available on MS Teams (usually on mobile app) for chat. If urgent, you can use the MS Teams call. If you believe that your case or question cannot be explained or resolved in a quick chat, I recommend a contact by email.

Please remember that the office hours are primarily for questions about the lesson contents. Before contacting, please review your lecture notes and make sure you know what you don’t understand. 


BACK

item.title: About Absence (FAQ)
item.description:
In the past, I received some inqueries concerning "absence." I assembled here the basic information to answer most frequently asked questions: 

  1. Students have the obligation to attend the lecture;
  2. Students have the right to miss 2 lessons for the 45-hour course, 3 lessons for the 60-hour course, without excuse;
  3. If you are ill or have to go away because of study-related business, with the presentation of the proof, your absence will be excused;
  4. Other reasons do not constitute the reason for your absence;
  5. Even with excuse, the number of your absence must not exceed 10.

When you are absent because of your work or some urgent personal matter, I said I will consider the circumstance of your absence, BUT it will be still counted as “absence.” Please remember the item (1) above.






BACK
